significance.title: Significance of the findings:
significance.termDescriptionAriaLabel: eLife assessments use a common vocabulary to describe significance. The term chosen for this paper is:
significance.termDescription: Valuable: Contains findings that have theoretical or practical implications for a subfield.

strength.title: Strength of evidence:
strength.termDescriptionAriaLabel: eLife assessments use a common vocabulary to describe strength of evidence. The term or terms chosen for this paper is:
strength.termDescription: Solid: Methods, data and analyses broadly support the claims with only minor weaknesses.

summary: During the peer-review process the editor and reviewers write an eLife Assessment that summarises the significance of the findings reported in the article (on a scale ranging from landmark to useful) and the strength of the evidence (on a scale ranging from exceptional to inadequate). Learn more about eLife Assessments
